intro: Lippia harleyi, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the verbena family (Verbenaceae) and is characterized by its aromatic, often fragrant leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are used in traditional medicine for their antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties. Lippia harleyi is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
